summary: Zimbabwe is a landlocked country in Southeast Africa with a population of about 15 million. The Shona people, part of the Bantu ethnic group, built the ancient city-state of Great Zimbabwe, a major trade center. The region was later colonized by the British and named Rhodesia. In 1980, Zimbabwe gained independence, and Robert Mugabe became Prime Minister. His long rule was marked by authoritarianism and economic struggles. In 2017, a coup led to Mugabe's resignation, and Emmerson Mnangagwa became President. Zimbabwe has multiple official languages and is part of various international organizations.
title: Zimbabwe
